IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: J-27 is equipped with a mobile recording device. TFC Phillips body camera was functional and recording. Defendant: Lorenzo De La Cruz Bolanos Date of Birth: 08/02/1997 Date of Arrest: 07/03/2023 Time of Arrest: 0203 hours MD DL: MD-10272059251 DUI #: J-23-123 TRAINING/CERTIFICATIONS: * I am trained and certified in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. * I am trained and certified to conduct preliminary breathalyzer tests by the Maryland State Police. * I am trained to detect controlled dangerous substances (CDS) through the Maryland State Police, in addition to my training knowledge and experience gained through multiple CDS arrests. * I am certified in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE). PHASE 1: On Monday, 07/03/2023, at approximately 0143 hours, I, Trooper First Class Phillips #6584 of the Maryland State Police Annapolis Barrack, was in the uniform of the day and operating marked patrol vehicle J-27. I was sitting stationary at the crossover looking at traffic going Eastbound Route 50 prior to Route 97 in the area of Annapolis, Anne Arundel County, Maryland. I observed a silver Honda Civic in lane 2 with a right inoperable headlight. Upon observing these violations, I activated my emergency equipment and initiated a traffic stop on West Street at Hudson Street, Annapolis, Anne Arundel County, Maryland. PHASE 2: I approached the vehicle from the drivers side and identified myself. I identified the driver by his MD drivers license as Lorenzo De La Cruz Bolanos, H/M, DOB: 08/02/1997. I asked Bolanos where he was coming from, and Bolanos replied he was coming from the MGM casino. While speaking with Bolanos, I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from his breath and person. I observed his eyes to be glassy and bloodshot. When asked about the consumption of alcoholic beverages, Bolanos stated that he had not consumed anything. I asked Bolanos to exit the vehicle and come to the front of his vehicle. I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from his breath and person. I again asked Bolanos how many alcoholic beverages he had consumed prior to driving, and he stated that he had two tall boy cans of Twisted Teas. PHASE 3: I requested Bolanos to perform Standardized Field Sobriety Tests to which he agreed. The tests were performed in front of his vehicle for safety. The surface was dry and free from any obvious debris. The weather was clear. Lighting condition consisted of streetlights, my patrol vehicles headlights, and flashlights. The patrol vehicles forward emergency lights were deactivated during all tests. Bolanos was positioned in a manner to ensure that headlights from passing traffic would not interfere with the test results. Prior to beginning the test, I asked Bolanos the following questions: Glasses or contacts: None. Medical conditions: None. Injuries: None: Medication: None. HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6 clues observed): The Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test was explained and administered per NHSTA SFST manual. I asked Bolanos if he understood the test instructions, and he replied that he did. Bolanos pupils were equal in size and displayed equal tracking. Bolanos displayed a lack of smooth pursuit, distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation, and the onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes. Vertical gaze nystagmus was present. WALK AND TURN (4/8 clues observed): The test was explained and demonstrated per the NHTSA SFST manual. I asked Bolanos if he understood the test instructions, and he replied that he did. Instructional position: Bolanos was unable to maintain balance during the instructional phase and completely broke his stance once. Bolanos started to do the test while I was explaining the instructions for the test. First 9 steps: Bolanos took 10 steps. The Turn: Completed. Second 9 Steps: Bolanos stopped walking. Bolanos took 10 steps. ONE LEG STAND (0/4 clues observed): No clues observed ARREST: On 07/03/2023 at 0203 hours, Bolanos was placed under arrest for driving while under the influence of alcohol. Bolanos was transported to the Maryland State Police Annapolis Barrack for further processing. While transporting Bolanos, the odor of an alcoholic beverage filled the interior of my patrol vehicle. At the barrack, I played Bolanos the audio version in English of the DR-15 Advice of Rights from the MVAs website. Bolanos was provided a copy to follow along and stated that he understood the form. At 0233 hours, Bolanos refused to submit to the chemical breath test. I conducted the 20-minute observation period with Bolanos at the barrack. A preliminary search of Bolanos revealed that he had nothing in his mouth. RELEASED: Bolanos was issued all appropriate citations and paperwork. Bolanos was released from the barracks to his girlfriend. I requested this case be closed by arrest. All events occurred in Anne Arundel County, Maryland.
